alert.note: Alert for Hatteras Island; Mainland Dare; Mainland Hyde; Northern Outer Banks; Tyrrell (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 06 at 5:13PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Hyde, central Dare and southeastern Tyrrell Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 513 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Stumpy Point to 8 miles northeast of Middletown to near Rose Bay. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Stumpy Point, Gull Rock, Swindell Fork, Fairfield, Rodanthe, New Holland, Nebraska, Rose Bay, Lake Landing, Middletown, Fort Landing, Lake Mattamuskeet, Swan Quarter Ferry Terminal and Bodie Island Lighthouse. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Hatteras Island; Mainland Dare; Mainland Hyde; Northern Outer Banks; Tyrrell
